name: Percent impervious area [Pacific Territories]
description: These maps illustrate the percent of total land within each Census place or block group that is impervious. Impervious surfaces do not allow the penetration of water and include buildings, roads, and sidewalks. For the U.S. Pacific Island Territories of American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI), impervious surface classification is based on the 2022 NOAA Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) dataset.
tags: development, urban, human, runoff, heat island, temperature, Biodiversity Conservation, Clean Air, Clean and Plentiful Water, Climate Stabilization, Natural Hazard Mitigation, land cover, concrete, asphalt, hard surface, storm water, flooding, sprawl, suburban, built environment, water supply, flow, heat retention, "Food, Fuel, and Materials", "Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics"

name: Impervious area per capita (m2/person) [Pacific Territories]
description: These maps estimate the square meters of land per person within each Census place or block group that is covered by impervious surfaces. Impervious surfaces do not allow the penetration of water and include buildings, roads, and sidewalks. For the U.S. Pacific Island Territories of American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI), impervious surface classification is based on the 2022 NOAA Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) dataset.
tags: development, urban, human, runoff, heat island, temperature, Climate Stabilization, Natural Hazard Mitigation, concrete, asphalt, hard surface, storm water, flooding, sprawl, suburban, land cover, built environment, water supply, flow, heat retention "Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics"

name: Percent vegetation [Pacific Territories]
description: These maps illustrate the percent of total land within each Census place or block group that is covered by vegetation (canopy or scrub/shrub). For the U.S. Pacific Island Territories of American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI), vegetation classification is based on the 2022 NOAA Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) dataset.

For the U.S. Pacific Island Territories of American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI), vegetation classification is based on the 2022 NOAA Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) dataset.

name: Percent tree canopy [Pacific Territories]
description: These maps estimate the percent of land area that is covered by tree canopy within each Census place or block group. For the U.S. Pacific Island Territories of American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI), tree canopy classification is based on the 2022 NOAA Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) dataset.

description: These maps estimate the square meters of land per person within each Census place or block group that is covered by tree canopy. name: Tree canopy to impervious ratio [Pacific Territories]
description: These maps illustrate the ratio of land area that is covered by tree canopy to land area covered by impervious surface within each Census place or block group. Impervious surfaces do not allow the penetration of water and include buildings, roads, and sidewalks. For the U.S. Pacific Island Territories of American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI), tree canopy and impervious surface classification is based on the 2022 NOAA Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) dataset.

name: Vegetation to impervious ratio [Pacific Territories]
description: These maps illustrate the ratio of land area that is covered by vegetation (canopy or scrub/shrub) to land area covered by impervious surface within each Census place or block group. Impervious surfaces do not allow the penetration of water and include buildings, roads, and sidewalks. For the U.S. Pacific Island Territories of American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI), vegetation and impervious surface classification is based on the 2022 NOAA Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) dataset.

name: Population [Pacific Territories]
description: These maps illustrate the 2020 population within each Census place or block group for American Samoa, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.
